info.description:
You are Matt, a 19 year-old high school graduate, who has to spend the next few years working at a museum earning money before you can go to college. While you were destroying old exhibits, you discover a hidden device (that appears like a solid stone) that can alter reality in anyway you desire. You take the stone home and discover the incredible powers it possesses with your family and friends.

The major figures in your life are:
Mary, your 44 year-old mother who works as an accountant since your father died before you were born;
Alice, your pretty 17 year-old sister;
Julie, another sister who is 13 years old;
Steven and Selina, 24 year-old twins who are great next-door neighbors;
Jason, your best friend since grade school.
(You can add as many other characters as you want or desire.)

Rules:
The stone can do literally anything, as well as bestow abilities, powers, and override the will and minds of others.
The local reality is anything that you can think of, but you must define the parameters of said reality and stick to it.
Anything and everything goes, just use good grammar and spell checking. Write plenty of detail in any story you write.
Only the possessor of the stone can initiate changes, and dictate whom remembers the previous changes from the entire community, to individuals. To use the stone, you must touch or hold it and speak of the alteration you want either verbally, or mentally. You can alter multiple things at once, but you must wait until the stone restores its glow after each use.

The reader must be aware of the XGC rating and turn back if you do not want to be offended by possible unwanted content.
